text: Nathan David Saatchi (24 December 1907 – 31 May 2000) was born in Iraq, then part of the Ottoman Empire. The name "Saatchi" saatçı (sā'ātchi), which means "watchmaker", originates from Turkish. He was a businessman and textile merchant who moved from Baghdad to London. Nathan Saatchi was born into a middle-class Jewish family on 24 December 1907 in Iraq. In 1936, he married Daisy Ezair, and they had four sons, including Maurice Saatchi and Charles Saatchi. He died on 31 May 2000 and is buried at Golders Green Jewish Cemetery. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:2000 deaths Category:British businesspeople Category:British Jews Category:British people of Iraqi-Jewish descent Category:Burials at Golders Green Jewish Cemetery Category:Iraqi businesspeople Category:Iraqi emigrants to the United Kingdom Category:Iraqi Jews Category:Naturalised citizens of the United Kingdom Category:People from Baghdad Nathan Category:20th-century businesspeople
title: Nathan Saatchi
